result.execSummary:
The defendant William E Schneiderwent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 BAIL APPLIED. Balance of $18.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with Trista S.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition time - (nonworking hours) STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.
Perform 40 hours for each year of Probation.

Defendant William E Schneiderwent in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for  2 years Probation - 1 day credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $268.00 - apply balance of bail - balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - apply bail from 15CF276    
- 6 months Drivers License Revocation.   
- Conditions of  Probation:  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No violent contact with Trista S..  Mental Health Counseling. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - Defendant to perform a total of 80 hours of community service - 40 hours for each year of Probation - and as a Condition of Probation
 -  20 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be
used at the Agents discretion.
